name: 'The Mists Of Avalon' Quiz | Authors | 25 Questions

questions.text: What are the names of the three sisters of Avalon?
questions.explanation:
Viviane, Igraine, Morgause.

	Viviane, Igraine, and Morgause are sisters. Morgaine is Igraine's daughter.

questions.text: What is the name of the silent priestess on Avalon, who has given her voice to the Goddess?
questions.explanation:
Raven.

	Raven only speaks several times throughout the book, and only when it is absolutely necessary.

questions.text: What is Arthur's childhood name?
questions.explanation:
Gwydion.

	Gwydion is his Pagan name. Arthur is his Christian name.

questions.text: Whom does Morgaine marry?
questions.explanation:
Uriens.

	Gwenhwyfar suggests that Morgaine marry Uriens. When she is asked about it, Morgaine agrees, thinking it is Accolon she will marry.

questions.text: Who is Morgause's young paramour throughout most of the second half of the book?
questions.explanation:
Lamorak.

	Lamorak is King Pellinore's son and Elaine's brother.

questions.text: Who ends up being the REAL traitor to Avalon?
questions.explanation:
Kevin (the Merlin).

	Kevin steals the Holy Regalia from Avalon's secret hiding place.

questions.text: Who are Nimue's parents?
questions.explanation:
Lancelet and Elaine.

	Nimue is the first daughter of Lancelet and Elaine, and is fostered in Avalon, as Elaine swore she would be before her birth.

questions.text: What happens to Gwenhwyfar at the end of the book?
options: She remains in Camelot, even after Arthur's death
questions.explanation:
She becomes a nun.

	After being caught committing adultery with Lancelet, Gwenhwyfar (always a devout Christian) commits herself to the convent on the Isle of the Priests.

questions.text: Who is Gwydion (Mordred) the spitting image of?
questions.explanation:
Lancelet.

	Gwydion is almost identical to Lancelet in his youth, which raises questions about his paternity. The reason he looks like Lancelet is because Lancelet is his parents' (Arthur's and Morgaine's) cousin.

questions.text: Who is responsible for Gwenhwyfar not bearing Arthur a child?
questions.explanation:
Morgause.

	It turned out that Morgause had been having a servant woman put something in Gwenhwyfar's drink all those years that would prevent her from conceiving. She did this so her fosterling, Gwydion (Arthur and Morgaine's son) would have the right to the throne.

questions.text: Who is Morgaine's father?
questions.explanation:
Gorlois.

	Igraine (Morgaine's mother) was forced into an arranged marriage to Gorlois when she was fourteen, and Morgaine was concieved from this marriage.

questions.text: Who does Arthur love above all else?
questions.explanation:
His sister, Morgaine.

	After their affair, Arthur told Morgaine that he would always love her and long for her, and it was mentioned several times throughout the book that she was the most important person in his life.

questions.text: Who kills Gareth?
questions.explanation:
Lancelot.

	As he is trying to escape from Camelot with Gwenhwyfar, Lancelet unintentionally kills Gareth, a man who he loves dearly.

questions.text: When Lancelet is sleeping with Elaine, who does he think it is?
questions.explanation:
Gwenhwyfar.

	He was drugged by Morgaine and then told that Gwenhwyfar was waiting for him in the tent in the woods.

questions.text: Who is Viviane's son?
questions.explanation:
Lancelet.

	Lancelet is Galahad, Viviane's son by King Ban.

questions.text: What is the name of the castle where Igraine was Duchess of Cornwall?
questions.explanation:
Tintagel.

	She was married to Gorlois, the Duke of Cornwall.

questions.text: Who took Morgaine's virginity at the Great Marriage?
questions.explanation:
Arthur.

	Viviane sent Morgaine to perform the Great Marriage ritual. She did not tell her that the man she would be performing it with was her brother.

questions.text: Who was Lady of the Lake after Viviane's death?
questions.explanation:
Niniane.

	Morgaine refused the honor, so Niniane (Taliesin's daughter) was appointed, even though she was not worthy of the position.

questions.text: What do all priestesses of Avalon have tattooed on their foreheads?
questions.explanation: Blue crescent.

questions.text: Who urged Gwenhwyfar into committing adultery with Lancelet?
questions.explanation:
Arthur.

	Arthur, drunk, asked Gwenhwyfar to sleep with Lancelet, in hopes of conceiving a baby.

questions.text: Who was responsible for Lancelet's banishment from Camelot?
questions.explanation:
Gwydion.

	Gwydion caught Lancelet and Gwenhwyfar together, and Lancelet was banished.

questions.text: Who is Morgaine's youngest stepson by her marriage to Uriens?
questions.explanation:
Uwaine.

	She was the only mother he had ever known.

questions.text: Where is Viviane buried?
questions.explanation:
The Isle of the Priests.

	Although Morgaine objects, Arthur chooses to bury Viviane on the Isle of the Priests.

questions.text: Who is Gwenhwyfar's brother that captures her and rapes her?
questions.explanation: Meleagrant.

questions.text: Who dies while retrieving the Grail?
questions.explanation:
Galahad.

	He was unprepared for the holiness of the Grail.
